oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Musselmjöl - nytt miljövänligt fodermedel
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Wahlberg, Carolina
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Feeding and growth
Recycling, balancing and resource management
Air and water emissions
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Mussel meal is produced in a pilot plant near Gothenburg in Sweden. Mussels filter sea water, and can thus recycle nitrogen and phosphorus from effluents. Instead of being a waste, surplus mussels from mussel producers can be converted into protein feed for animals. Mussel meal has already proved to have a high feeding value for poultry. Now mussel meal will be tested as a feed for growing-finishing pigs, within the CoreOrganic-funded research project ICOPP.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Wahlberg, Carolina (2012) Musselmjöl - nytt miljövänligt fodermedel. [Mussel meal - a new environmental-friendly feed ingredient.] Jordbruksaktuellt, 21 September 2012.
